### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

For the past week, anytime that I launch pieces I see this: 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/61f18fb6-8846-46d8-8747-5c415fd2e82d)

I tried to reinstall everything, but also no progress.

How to fix it? (Also to mention, Pieces desktop app is in Early Access program, but I don't know if this information is useful)

* The issue is being actively addressed by the Pieces team.
* A patch is expected within 24-48 hours.
* Users can provide their tech specs to the team for further assistance in the meantime.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.5

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I got a popup that there was a new version of Pieces OS and that I needed to click and restart to update. But now the desktop app won't start anymore, being stuck on the core dependencies.

I can click on the link, but nothing changes when I do that.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## Issue summary

- Issue 1: PiecesOS takes a long time to boot up
- Issue 2: PiecesOS fails to start completely

### Problem 1 - Long Boot Time
- Description: PiecesOS takes a long time to start (reported as several minutes by the user)
- Possible solutions:
   - Give PiecesOS more time (2 minutes) to migrate data from the previous stack.
   - Restart the Pieces for Developers Desktop application after waiting.
   - Schedule a call with Pieces team for assistance: https://calendar.app.google/MGd9i5gELtiDjWZm8

## Problem 2 - Failure to Launch
- Description: PiecesOS gets stuck on the dependencies scenario tab and does not progress. This issue persists after a fresh Windows installation.
- Possible solutions:
   - Schedule a call with Pieces team for assistance: https://calendar.app.google/8uw73ckfoXoz1dQb6
   - Provide user logs if available (location: windows: c:/Users/{USERNAME}/Documents/com.pieces.os/Support/logs)

## Additional Observations
- The issue appears to be more prevalent with older processors (pre-2015).

## Current Status

- Pieces team are elevating the priority of this issue due to the number of users affected.

## Outcome
- Issue 1: Resolved with a patch in version 11.1.1, but some users may still need assistance.
- Issue 2: Still under investigation and resolution.

related_issues.title: Cannot launch pieces-for-developers after new installation on MacOS Sequoia 15.2 M1 chip
related_issues.text:
Cannot launch pieces-for-developers after new installation on MacOS Sequoia 15.2 M1 chip
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I cannot install pieces Desktop App, or it fails to run.  I originally reported this by email on 9 Jan 2025, and the response email referred to an existing issue on github #546.  However this issue now seems closed, hence I am raising it here as a new bug.
 
I have recently installed pieces OS on my Mac with a package dmg.  The pieces OS appears to install, and I see the icon in the top bar.  Pieces appears to connect to the cloud successfully, and I can install plugins for Intellij, VSCode and Obsidian.  These are visible within the pieces OS icon at the top.  
 
Pieces appears to work from IDE plugins.   However I cannot launch the Desktop App, and ‘launch pieces for developers’ from the top Pieces menu fails silently.

I have recently upgraded Pieces OS, now on 11.1.1
 
Info:
 
Mac OS: Sequoia 15.2
Chip: Apple M1 Pro
 
Pieces OS: 11.1.1 (was installed as 11.0.3(
Pieces desktop app – won’t install
Pieces OS seems to be running in ‘activity monitor’
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation 

**Key Points:**

* PASimmons reported an issue with PiecesOS not running on their Mac with M1 chip.
* Mark Widman from Pieces offered troubleshooting steps and suggested using the correct build (Apple Silicon) for the user's hardware.
* PASimmons confirmed reinstalling Pieces with the Apple Silicon build resolved the issue.

**Problems Identified:**

* PiecesOS was not running on the user's Mac with M1 chip.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Reinstalling Pieces with the correct build (Apple Silicon) for the user's hardware.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is resolved. Mark Widman announced the resolution in #615.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolving PiecesOS launch failures:** This is the most pressing issue affecting users, particularly after the 11.1.1 update. Focus on resolving hardware compatibility issues, especially AVX2 support, to ensure a wider range of users can access PiecesOS.

**Improve communication around updates:** Provide clear and detailed information about potential compatibility issues before and after updates. This could include system requirement checks, known issues, and workarounds.

**Enhance hardware requirement documentation:** Clearly outline the minimum and recommended hardware requirements for PiecesOS on all supported platforms. This will help users avoid installation issues and ensure smoother onboarding.

**Develop a system for early detection of widespread issues:** Implement monitoring and analysis tools to quickly identify spikes in support tickets related to specific issues. This will enable faster response times and proactive communication with affected users.

**Consider creating a dedicated knowledge base article for launch failures:** Consolidate troubleshooting steps, FAQs, and workarounds for common launch issues in an easily accessible knowledge base article. This will empower users to resolve problems independently and reduce the load on support staff.

**Gather detailed system information during support requests:** Streamline the process for users to share system specs and logs when reporting launch failures. This will help the support team diagnose and resolve issues more efficiently.
